result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher F. REPPEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher F. REPPEN

records.addlTxt:
State moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor battery, contrary to Section 940.19(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Motion granted.   
Count 1 - Battery - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, disorderly conduct.   Motion granted.    Defendant must submit DNA sample.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-11-17 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

Pretrial Conference set for 12-01-2016 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 1.
Jury Trial set for 12-06-2016 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 1.
Plea date on September 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea date on July 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

AMENDED CASH BOND.
Amended to No Assaultive Contact with Kayla Bishop. Strict No Contact with Kaylee Evereats is still in effect.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Request to lift No Contact bail provision.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-01-2016 at 9:00 a.m.
BAIL MODIFICATION -
A written request by one of the victims to lift the no contact provision is given to the Court. The Court amends the bond to No Assaultive Contact with Kayla Bishop. The No Contact with Kaylee Evereates remains in effect.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Attorney Ralph J. Sczygelski.
Cover letter.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-05-16 ayt 10:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m.   
Notice.  
Minutes.
RE:  Kayla Bishop, on 12-20-15.

At 3:24 p.m., $750.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of strangulation and suffocation - dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-04-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $750.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Kayla Bishop or her residence at 1215 Green Street, Manitowoc, WI and with Kaylee Evraets.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.  
Minutes.
